item.title: Al
item.description: Al is a Perspective superimposed on Nature. It is a measurement of potential to a convergent point of with a limit of Bliss.

item.title: Alam
item.description: Alam is [[Am]] with [[Al]], and also the perspective of Alam. Alamic is an adjective for something Alam. Alamically is an adverb for something Alam.

item.title: Alamism
item.description: Alamism is a perspective on life centered around living in Bliss with the concepts of Alam. A practitioner is called an Alamist.

item.title: Alamist
item.description: Noun: A self-identifying practitioner of [[Alam]] Adjective: Relating to Alamism An Alamist’s Vision is to live in Bliss through Alam.

item.title: Am
item.description: Am is both anything and everything, including itself. ![[Aphorisms/Heart Aphorisms#^definition]] The root of Am is Attachment, and can only exist with Perspective Harmony.

item.title: Aphorisms
item.description: The core texts that underpin Alamism in its entirety. They are written in a way to be thought about during Introspection.

item.title: Attachment
item.description: Attachment, in a positive light, is healthy desire, acknowledgement, and Perspective. In a negative light, it is the opposite of Detachment.

item.title: Bliss
item.description: Bliss is a Perspective of trans-emotional tranquility, peace, and fulfillment of [[Alam]]. An Alamist lives in bliss through cultivating Al through Practice.

item.title: Detachment
item.description: Detachment is letting go of (unhealthy) desire, an application of Mindfulness. Detachment is Alam, but if misunderstood as detathment from happiness or peace, could be conversely disalamic.

item.title: Faith in Alam
item.description: Strong belief that Alam brings about Bliss, to the point where your mind can resist strong temptations and choose Alamic paths.

item.title: Introspection
item.description: Introspection is utilizing Attachment and Visions via the Self to make plans for Nature to collapse into Bliss. This can often be done by studying Aphorisms and applying their messages.

item.title: Mindfulness
item.description: In Alamism, mindfulness is conscious Perspective without Self. This is achieved through Meditation (by definition). Meditation In Alamism, meditation only refers to one specific thing: Alamic Practice of mindfulness.

item.title: Nature
item.description: When used in Alamism “Nature” refers to Perspective of reality. Physics is perspective into the laws of Nature. In science, everything is considered “Nature” and thus everything follows a certain set of laws deterministically.

item.title: Perspective
item.description: Perspectives are beliefs or assumptions. Any [[Am]] that assumes has perspective. Note that perspective does not require any kind of “thought.

item.title: Perspective Dissonance
item.description: When various Perspectives disagree. Counterpart of Perspective Harmony.

item.title: Perspective Harmony
item.description: When various Perspectives agree. Counterpart of Perspective Dissonance Alamism rejects absolute “truth” and replaces it with Perspective Harmony.

item.title: Practice
item.description: Practice is action that changes the range or ease of actions. For example, going for a jog once is practice for going on a jog another time.

item.title: Self
item.description: The concept of “self” is a Perspective brought about by what is called one’s conscious. Through Nature, humans have a complicated array of perspectives arranged in a way capable of “thought,” on it’s own capable of perspective.

item.title: Vision
item.description: As opposed to “goals,” Visions are ideals meant to be sustained indefinitely. I suppose visions are goals, technically. When people think they have no goals or no purpose, they indeed have the goal to have goals.
